data.description:
Bug: NGramModel.train() expects Iterable[str] (list of documents), but passing a single string iterates over characters, causing character-level predictions instead of word-level.

Found in: scripts/cognitive_integration_demo.py
Fixed by: Changing ngram.train(text) to ngram.train([text]) or ngram.train(texts_list)

Action needed:
1. Search codebase for other uses of NGramModel.train() or similar train() APIs
2. Check if the same bug exists in examples, tests, or other scripts
3. Consider adding a warning when train() receives a single string
4. Update documentation to clarify expected input format

This is a common Python gotcha where str is iterable but iterates as characters.
data.title: Investigate SparkSLM train() API pattern bug across codebase
